# Pull Request

## Description

Please include a summary of the changes and which issue is fixed. Include relevant motivation and context.

Fixes # (issue)

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] New language example
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Refactoring

## Language/Platform

- [ ] Solidity/EVM
- [ ] Vyper
- [ ] Rust (Solana/NEAR/Substrate)
- [ ] Move (Aptos/Sui)
- [ ] Python
- [ ] Go
- [ ] Java/Kotlin
- [ ] Swift
- [ ] C++
- [ ] Haskell/Plutus
- [ ] AssemblyScript
- [ ] TypeScript/JavaScript
- [ ] Bash/Shell
- [ ] Other: ___________

## Testing

- [ ] Tests pass locally
- [ ] Added new tests for new features
- [ ] Updated existing tests
- [ ] All CI checks pass

## Code Quality

- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Self-reviewed my own code
- [ ] Commented code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] Made corresponding changes to documentation
- [ ] No new warnings generated
- [ ] Added inline documentation/JSDoc/NatSpec comments

## Security

- [ ] No private keys or sensitive data in code
- [ ] Input validation implemented
- [ ] Access control properly implemented
- [ ] Gas optimization considered (for smart contracts)
- [ ] Security best practices followed

## Deployment Checklist (if applicable)

- [ ] Contract compiles successfully
- [ ] Tests pass with high coverage
- [ ] Gas usage is acceptable
- [ ] Deployment script updated
- [ ] Documentation updated

## Screenshots (if applicable)

Add screenshots to help explain your changes.

## Additional Context

Add any other context about the pull request here.

## Reviewer Notes

Special instructions for reviewers or areas that need particular attention.
